results.justification: The document explicitly states the methodology, focusing on feature engineering and machine learning algorithms for collusion detection. (e.g., "We used feature engineering and ML algorithms to create a model for the detection of collusion.")

The document provides a step-by-step description of the experimental design, including data collection, feature engineering, model training, and validation. (e.g., Sections 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3 detail the process.)

The document states that the iQuiz tool and collected data are publicly available. (e.g., "To enhance the usability and reproducibility of our work, we have open-sourced the iQuiz tool and made the collected data publicly available.") and provides a DOI: https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.23744283.v1

Section 3.1 provides a description of the data entries in the log file, acting as a data dictionary. (e.g., "Student – User identification number", "Question – Numeric variable describing the question number.")

Data collection methods are fully described, detailing the online assessments, iQuiz tool, Moodle integration, and the two settings (experimental and empirical). (e.g., Section 3.1 provides details on the assessments, tool, and settings.)
The document states that the iQuiz tool has been open-sourced. (e.g., "To enhance the usability and reproducibility of our work, we have open-sourced the iQuiz tool...")
While the iQuiz tool is open-sourced, the document does not explicitly state whether the scripts for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization are included or publicly available.

The document describes statistical tests (e.g., stratified five-fold cross-validation), models (LR, SVM, DT, XGB, RF), and reports evaluation metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score). (e.g., Section 3.3 and 4.1)

The analysis is primarily quantitative. While personality test results are mentioned, they are used to support quantitative findings rather than being the focus of a qualitative analysis with detailed coding and interpretation.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration.
The results of the experiment, including the performance of different classifiers and feature importance, are shared. (e.g., Section 4.1 and Figures 3 & 4)
The document discusses limitations, such as the use of experimental datasets and the potential for coincidental observations. (e.g., the last paragraph of Section 4.2)
